body.head.byline: By ALAN FEUER; Compiled by John Sullivan

abstract.p: Abdulrahman Farhane, Brooklyn bookseller, is sentenced to 13 years in prison for plotting to buy arms for Islamic fighters in Afghanistan in late 2001 (S)

block.p: A bookseller was sentenced yesterday in Federal District Court to 13 years in prison for plotting to buy arms for Islamic fighters in Afghanistan. Prosecutors say that the bookseller, Abdulrahman Farhane, 53, met with an undercover federal informant in his bookstore in late 2001 to discuss ways to send money overseas to buy weapons for the fighters. Three other men, including a jazz musician and an emergency room doctor, have also pleaded guilty to terrorism charges in the case and are awaiting sentencing.
